action.action-desc: Mr. Garamendi (for himself and Mr. LaMalfa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To provide for the conveyance of a small parcel of real property at Beale Air Force Base in California to the Three Rivers Levee Improvement Authority.

section.header: Land conveyance, Beale Air Force Base, California

subsection.text: Not later than 60 days after the date on which the Three Rivers Levee Improvement Authority submits a written request to the Secretary of the Air Force to proceed with the conveyance described in this section, the Secretary shall convey to the Three Rivers Levee Improvement Authority all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the parcel of real property consisting of approximately 0.218 acres at Beale Air Force Base in California and identified as Impacted Area on the map entitled T.R.L.I.A. 200-year Goldfields Levee Project, Proposed Easement Acquisition from Beale A.F.B. and dated May 1, 2020, for the purpose of permitting the Three Rivers Levee Improvement Authority to use the property for the flood damage reduction project, Yuba River Basin, California, authorized by section 101(a)(10) of the Water Resources Development Act of 1999 (Public Law 106–53; 113 Stat. 275), as modified by section 1305 of the America’s Water Infrastructure Act of 2018 (Public Law 115–270).
The Secretary of the Air Force shall convey the real property described in subsection (a) by quitclaim deed and without consideration.

paragraph.text: The Secretary of the Air Force may make clerical and typographical corrections to the map referred to in subsection (a). Such map and any revised map prepared under the authority of this paragraph shall have the same force and effect as if included as part of this Act.
The map referred to in subsection (a) and any revised map prepared under the authority of paragraph (1) shall be available for public inspection on a website of the Department of the Air Force.

subsection.text: The exact acreage and legal description of the real property to be conveyed under subsection (a) shall be determined by a survey satisfactory to the Secretary of the Air Force. The cost of the survey shall be borne by the Three Rivers Levee Improvement Authority.
The conveyance under subsection (a) shall be subject to any other terms and conditions that the Secretary of the Air Force considers appropriate to protect the interests of the United States.
